  • Reference

    import_featdata

    import_featdata.Rd

    Function imports data from the Denver FEAT data archive (See below).

    Usage

    import_featdata(featdata = NULL, simplify.names = TRUE, ...)

    Arguments

    featdata

    Character, data set name (see below)

    simplify.names

    Logical, if TRUE, simplifies the column names of the found data set by converting them to lower case and changing underscores to dots.

    ...

    Currently ignored.

    Value

    import_featdata attempts to match featdata and, if found, returns it as a data.frame.

    The function uses base R code and foreign::read.dbf to download, read and tidy data. The as.is=TRUE argument is applied when reading data so, for example, date and time columns are imported as character

    vectors rather than factors.

    Details

    The function imports data from the FEAT data archive.

    datasetdatatyperef

    Note

    In-development: code may be subject to significant change; Currently, only some data sets can be downloaded from the FEAT archive. (See Details above for list of data sets available using import_featdata; please check main archive, if you are after any other FEAT data not listed here.)

    References

    For foreign package and read.dbf:

    R Core Team (2022). _foreign: Read Data Stored by 'Minitab', 'S', 'SAS', 'SPSS', 'Stata', 'Systat', 'Weka', 'dBase', ..._. R package version 0.8-82, <https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=foreign>.

    For general information about FEAT:

    D.H. Stedman and G.A. Bishop. Measuring the Emissions of Passing Cars, Acc. Chem. Res., 29:489-495, 1996.

    D.A. Burgard, G.A. Bishop, R.S. Stadtmuller, T.R. Dalton and D.H. Stedman, Spectroscopy Applied to On-Road Mobile Source Emissions. Appl. Spectrosc., 60:5:135A-148A, 2006.

    And, for specific campaigns/data sets, please reference using study reference(s), listed as associated DOI(s) in Details above.

    See also

    foreign::read.dbf.
